mixed-citation.article-title: The Changhsingian (Late Permian) ammonoids from Baghuk Mountain (Central Iran)

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Pseudogastrioceras relicuum Korn & Ghaderi
in
Korn et al. , 2016: 852
, text-fig. 12.

Pseudogastrioceras
with moderately large conch; diameter attaining 70 mm . Conch shape thinly discoidal (ww/dm=0.40–0.45), involute (uw/dm = 0.05–0.10) with converging flanks and broadly rounded venter. Ornament with about 15 faint spiral lines on the venter.

p.tp:material-citation:
Holotype IRAN • East Azerbaijan , Ali Bashi N section ;
Paratirolites Limestone
; illustrated by Korn & Ghaderi in
Korn et al. (2016
: text-fig. 12); MB.C.25173 .

tp:treatment-sec.p:
IRAN • 2 specimens ; Esfahan Province , Baghuk Mountain 1 section; Hambast Formation ; MB.C.29659 to MB.C.29660
•
1 specimen ; Esfahan Province , Baghuk Mountain G section ; Hambast Formation ; MB.C.29661
•
2 specimens ; Esfahan Province , Baghuk Mountain H section ; Hambast Formation ; MB.C.29662 to MB.C.29663
.

All specimens are rather poorly preserved, but MB.C.29661 is the best of them, though somewhat deformed ( Fig. 16 ). It is a corroded specimen with a 56 mm conch diameter, which does not allow accurate measurements of the conch.

Paratirolites Limestone
; 6.80 to 3.30 m below the extinction horizon (
Dzhulfites nodosus Zone
to
Paratirolites lanceolobatus Zone
).
